description: The Viazemskskaia Lavra (Monastery). A notorious night shelter where the worst criminals of St. Petersburg found shelter. It has since been altered into a children's asylum.; Karl Karlovitz Bulla (Russian, 1854 - 1929); about 1910; Gelatin silver print; 16.2 x 23 cm (6 3/8 x 9 1/16 in.); 84.XP.224.43; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
